title: Europa League final fever builds in Bilbao before Tottenham v Manchester United – live
snippets:
• All the latest news before the final, 8pm BST kick-off
  • Jonathan Wilson: why this game matters | Email Will

Right, time to play a searching 40-yard crossfield pass to Will Unwin, who’ll talk you through the rest of the morning. Bye.

Elsewhere, Nick Ames has been in Kyiv reporting on how amputee football is helping Ukraine’s war-wounded.

“It’s about emotional gain, helping them rediscover this will to live. In some cases they’re now doing something they weren’t able to before their injuries. The key thing is that we don’t kick anyone out of a team. If you want to play, come to training and let’s do it. Everyone can try, we’ll always encourage each other.”

Continue reading...
titles: Europa League final fever builds in Bilbao before Tottenham v Manchester United – live
summary: The Europa League final between Tottenham and Manchester United is set for an 8pm BST kick-off. Coverage includes insights from Jonathan Wilson on the significance of the match and reports from Nick Ames in Kyiv on amputee football aiding Ukraine's war-wounded. The program emphasizes emotional recovery and inclusivity, encouraging all interested to participate in the sport.
constructiveness_reason: This story provides useful insights into the significance of the match and the role of amputee football in aiding Ukraine's war-wounded. It increases awareness about the importance of emotional recovery and inclusivity in sports. However, it does not clearly highlight solutions or progress, limiting its score.

title: There’s no shame in being beaten by the best. And Gary Lineker showed us fellow sport presenters just how to do it | Adrian Chiles
snippets:
Through dedication and sheer graft, the football legend transformed himself from a hopeless presenter into an elite one. It’s unlikely we will ever see that happen again

Amid the controversy around Gary Lineker’s exit from the BBC, a couple of points need making, entirely unrelated to the circumstances of his departure. First, how vanishingly unlikely it is we’ll ever again see an elite footballer become an elite presenter. Second, that when he started out on the road to being a consummate broadcaster, he was absolutely hopeless.

I say this as someone whose broadcasting career covers roughly the same period. Someone who played a distant second fiddle to Lineker’s first violin at BBC Sport, before becoming his rival and opposite number when I took on the role of lead sports presenter at ITV. In that contest, there turned out to be only one winner. And it wasn’t me. I must admit, I did occasionally give in to annoyance and bitterness along the way, but whatever. I know when I’m beaten. There’s no shame in being beaten by the best. And I wasn’t alone: naming ITV football presenters seen off by Lineker is a bit like remembering failed US presidential candidates. I’ll be Mitt Romney.

Continue reading...
titles: There’s no shame in being beaten by the best. And Gary Lineker showed us fellow sport presenters just how to do it | Adrian Chiles
summary: Gary Lineker, a former elite footballer, has been recognized for his exceptional transformation into an elite sports presenter, a journey marked by significant improvement from his initial struggles. His departure from the BBC has sparked discussions, highlighting the rarity of such a career transition in sports broadcasting. A fellow broadcaster and former rival at ITV acknowledges Lineker's unparalleled skills in the field, despite personal challenges and competition, ultimately conceding defeat to Lineker's superior talent.
constructiveness_reason: This story provides a deep understanding of the career transition in sports broadcasting, highlighting Gary Lineker's journey from an elite footballer to an elite sports presenter. It offers insights into personal challenges and competition in the field, making it useful for readers interested in sports broadcasting. However, it doesn't clearly highlight progress or solutions, hence the score.

title: Israel-Gaza war live: more than 80 killed in latest strikes as aid deliveries condemned as ‘ridiculously inadequate’
snippets:
Doctors Without Borders says deliveries are just ‘a smokescreen to pretend the siege is over’

  • Israel still blocking aid for Gaza despite promise to lift siege, says UN

Reuters has spoken to Mahmoud al-Haw at one of the soup kitchens in Gaza. The father-of-four says he has been regularly waiting in crowds for up to six hours to obtain food, and sometimes returns empty-handed.

“I have a sick daughter. I can’t provide her with anything. There is no bread, there is nothing,” the 39-year-old told the news agency.

Continue reading...

title: Weight Loss Breakthrough: Scientists Discover Key to Fat-Burning Power in Human Cells
snippets: Blocking Mitch, a protein that regulates energy control, prevents fat from accumulating in human cells. About a decade ago, a new generation of weight-loss drugs promised a slimmer, healthier future. But there was a catch: while these medications helped shed fat, they also led to a loss of muscle mass. Now, scientists may be on [...]
titles: Weight Loss Breakthrough: Scientists Discover Key to Fat-Burning Power in Human Cells
summary: Scientists have discovered that blocking a protein named Mitch can prevent fat accumulation in human cells, potentially offering a new avenue for weight loss treatments. This finding addresses a significant drawback of previous weight-loss drugs, which, although effective in reducing fat, also led to undesirable muscle mass loss. This breakthrough could pave the way for developing more effective and balanced weight-loss therapies.
constructiveness_reason: This story is constructive as it provides the reader with a deeper understanding of a new scientific discovery that has potential implications for weight loss treatments. It highlights progress in the field of weight loss research and offers actionable insights for those interested in the development of new therapies.

title: Scientists Discover Powerful Anti-Cancer Benefits of Popular Weight Loss Drugs
snippets: After adjusting for the weight loss benefits of surgery, GLP-1 drugs were linked to a 41% lower risk of obesity-related cancer. New research presented at the European Congress on Obesity (ECO) in Malaga, Spain, and published in the journal eClinicalMedicine, suggests that some widely used weight-loss medications may do more than just help people slim [...]
titles: Scientists Discover Powerful Anti-Cancer Benefits of Popular Weight Loss Drugs
summary: Researchers have found that GLP-1 weight loss drugs may significantly reduce the risk of obesity-related cancers by 41%, even after adjusting for the benefits of weight loss through surgery. This discovery was presented at the European Congress on Obesity in Malaga, Spain, and published in eClinicalMedicine.
constructiveness_reason: This story is constructive because it reports on a significant discovery that links weight loss drugs to a reduced risk of obesity-related cancers. It increases awareness about the potential benefits of these drugs beyond weight loss, and provides useful information for those considering their use.
